notes.text:
Updated images are now available for Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security. The
updated image includes bug and security fixes.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Critical. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This release of RHACS 4.3.6 provides the following bug fix:

* Fixed an issue where an incorrectly configured Jira notifier causes the Central component of RHACS to enter a crash loop

It provides the following security fixes:

* go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can lead to path traversal and RCE on go-git clients (CVE-2023-49569)
* helm: Missing YAML content leads to panic (CVE-2024-26147)
* helm: Shows secrets with --dry-run option in clear text (CVE-2019-25210)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Helm that may lead to sensitive information disclosure. When the --dry-run flag is used in Helm 3, it displays values of secrets. Helm 2 just displays the fact that a secret has been created.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: helm: shows secrets with --dry-run option in clear text
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.3, you are advised to upgrade to patch release 4.3.6.

vulnerabilities.title: helm: shows secrets with --dry-run option in clear text

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A path traversal vulnerability was discovered in the go library go-git. This issue may allow an attacker to create and amend files across the filesystem when applications are using the default ChrootOS, potentially allowing remote code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can lead to path traversal and RCE on go-git clients
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This problem only affects the go implementation and not the original git cli code. Applications using BoundOS or in-memory filesystems are not affected by this issue. Clients should be limited to connect to only trusted git servers to reduce the risk of compromise.

In OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) the vulnerable github.com/go-git/go-git/v5 Go package is used as a dependency in many components where the vulnerable function is not used, hence the impact by this vulnerability is reduced to Low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.3, you are advised to upgrade to patch release 4.3.6.
In cases where a bump to the latest version of go-git is not possible, a recommendation to reduce the exposure of this threat is limiting its use to only trust-worthy Git servers.

vulnerabilities.title: go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can lead to path traversal and RCE on go-git clients

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Helm. This flaw may lead to a panic when Helm parses index and plugin yaml files missing expected content, leading to a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: helm: Missing YAML Content Leads To Panic
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat rates this as Moderate since this would impact the Helm client and requires a malicious plugin to be in place, which can be removed.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.3, you are advised to upgrade to patch release 4.3.6.

If a malicious plugin has been added which is causing all Helm client commands to panic, the malicious plugin can be manually removed from the filesystem.

If using Helm SDK versions prior to 3.14.2, calls to affected functions can use recover to catch the panic.

vulnerabilities.title: helm: Missing YAML Content Leads To Panic
